programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Re-airs of classic NFL Super Bowls, Championships and regular season games featuring some of the game's greatest.

programme.desc: Joe Burrow rebounds from calf injury, throws season-best 259 yards, leading the Cincinnati Bengals to 19-16 victory over the Los Angeles Rams.

programme.title: Condensed Game
programme.desc: The Raiders overcame a 10-point fourth quarter deficit to defeat the Kansas City Chiefs on the final play of this divisional game.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Los Angeles Chargers quarterback Justin Herbert threw for 275 yards and three touchdowns as the Chargers beat the New York Giants 37-21. L.A.'s defense dominated early, and a 59-yard touchdown to Jalen Guyton helped seal the Week 14 win at home.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Kenneth Walker III leads the Seattle Seahawks to a comeback win, rushing for 84 of his 103 yards in the second half as they defeat the Denver Broncos 26-20. Seahawks head coach Mike Macdonald secures his first victory as head coach.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Detroit Lions quarterback Jared Goff makes NFL history completing all 18 of his pass attempts to help lead the Detroit Lions to a 42-29 Monday Night Football win over the Seattle Seahawks.

programme.title: NFL Explained
programme.desc: Learn about the evolution of NFL jerseys, starting from the history of football uniforms, tracing their development from simple beginnings to the high-tech designs, manufacturing, and design.

programme.title: NFL Explained - Evolution of EVERY teams' logo (and helmet!)
programme.desc: Do you know which 2 teams have a different logo on each side of their helmet? Do you know the story behind logos like Brownie the Elf or Steely McBeam? How about the mystery behind the NFL shield? It's time for another NFL Explained history lesson.

programme.desc: Relive some of the most exciting play-by-play calls in NFL history.

programme.title: Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show
programme.desc: Welcome to Episode 22 of the Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show presented by Duke Cannon! Jared Bernhardt joins the show! Berny talks about still having to knock the rust off in the PLL, even after a 4 goal 5 pt performance against Utah. Jared talks about the Maryland days, and gives us his favorite stories from his time in the NFL. The boys breakdown week 4 in the PLL. Are the Whips back? What do they do with Matt Rambo? programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: Pot-Limit Omaha returns, as does Lou Garza with the chip lead. Garza looks for retribution in Event #9 ahead of Sean Winter, Miles Rampel, Jeremy Ausmus, and Ben Lamb as $365,500 awaits the winner.

programme.title: Doubles Poker Championship
programme.desc: Thirty-two of the best professional poker players in the world buy in for $50,000 apiece, but there's a twist. They are then randomly paired off and compete as two-person teams that share the play on each hand. With $1 million in first place prize money at stake, which team will survive the gauntlet of clashing personalities and top shelf competition in a game that's usually a single-minded endeavor?

programme.desc: A Mexican-American War veteran, Jeremiah Johnson (Robert Redford), heads to the mountains to live in isolation. Woefully unequipped for the task at hand, Johnson is fortunate to come across a seasoned mountain man (Will Geer) willing to teach him the necessary survival tactics. As life continues in the mountains, Johnson finds himself a native bride (Delle Bolton) and an adopted son (Josh Albee). However, their peaceful existence is threatened when Johnson incurs the ire of the Crow Indians.

programme.desc: Gunmen pit homesteaders against cattlemen.

programme.desc: A minister wants to build an orphanage on copper-bearing land.

But the sheriff finds himself acting on Halliday's behalf when the latter is slain, leading to the famed gun battle at the O.K. Corral.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene struggles to cope with the stress of construction; Lou returns as Mark's contrabassoon teacher.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Ben and Darlene are excited to share their good news with the family, but Neville and Jackie, and Aldo and Harris, share their own very similar news.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners gear up for a megawedding; Jackie & Neville, Darlene & Ben, Harris & Aldo are planning for a big day, but discover that some of the couples may not be on the same page.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: In an effort to save money, Darlene and Ben, and Jackie and Neville head off on their joint honeymoon, where their cost-saving measures contribute to a tension-filled getaway.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Jackie moves in with Neville, he shows up to their home with an excess of animals from his vet office; Darlene and Ben argue Darlene is turning into her father.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark is anxious to get his driver's license; Darlene attempts to teach Mark to drive, but her frantic energy sends him running to Ben for help; Harris meets a new guy online.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When a relative passes away unexpectedly, the family must debate about who should gain custody of a jaded nephew, who is just shy of his 18th birthday.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Problems arise on Beverly Rose's first day of kindergarten; Becky and Darlene have a disagreement.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris takes a stand on an issue that ruffles a few feathers in Darlene's new neighborhood.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene receives a promotion, but she quickly learns the fancy title is not all it's cracked up to be; when Louise loses her job at Casita Bonita, an opportunity arises.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie must come to terms with her mother becoming ill; Darlene's job hunt proves to be more difficult than anticipated.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene, Ben, Becky and Beverly Rose move into the new house, where Darlene implements a new set of rules.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan meets his in-laws for the first time when Louise's family comes to visit; Darlene helps Becky with a parenting problem.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The death of a beloved teacher from Dan and Jackie's high school brings old classmates together.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Family Feud
programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. Each team's goal is to guess the results of audience survey questions. A player from each team initially faces off, answering the question to earn the chance to either pass or play. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

programme.title: Phantasm: Remastered
programme.desc: The residents of a small town have begun dying under strange circumstances, leading young Mike (Michael Baldwin) to investigate. After discovering that the Tall Man (Angus Scrimm), the town's mortician, is killing and reanimating the dead as misshapen zombies, Mike seeks help from his older brother, Jody (Bill Thornbury), and local ice cream man Reggie (Reggie Bannister). Working together, they try to lure out and kill the Tall Man, all the while avoiding his minions and a deadly silver sphere.

programme.title: Sleepaway Camp
programme.desc: Following the death of her family, Angela is sent to a camp for the summer. After her arrival, brutal accidents begin to kill the other campers.

programme.title: Amityville: The Evil Escapes
programme.desc: The demonic forces that haunted the infamous Long Island house escape through a mystical lamp to California, where evil manipulates a little girl.

programme.title: Amityville: Dollhouse
programme.desc: A miniature dollhouse replica of an infamous haunted house gifted to a little girl unleashes a full-sized, terrifying evil upon her unprepared family.

programme.title: Deadcon
programme.desc: A group of young celebrities must unravel the mystery behind a vengeful spirit at the biggest digital event of the year, Viewcon.

programme.title: Elvira's Movie Macabre: Monstroid
programme.desc: The Mistress of the Dark screens this chemically induced stinker from 1980 after offering a peek behind the curtain at her careful curation process.

programme.title: Stepfather III: Father's Day
programme.desc: An escaped madman (Robert Wightman) romances a California divorcee; luckily her son knows how to use a computer.

programme.title: The House on Sorority Row
programme.desc: After a prank goes terribly wrong, a group of sorority sisters are picked off one by one. Who is this mysterious stalker and can they be stopped?

programme.title: Sweet 16
programme.desc: A lonely girl tries to make new friends, but she might spend her 16th birthday alone behind bars, since every boy she meets soon ends up dead.

programme.title: The Convent
programme.desc: A coed (Joanna Canton) and a former mental patient (Adrienne Barbeau) battle Satanists who slaughter and transform students into evil undead creatures.

programme.title: Nightbreed
programme.desc: Aaron Boone (Craig Sheffer) is haunted by terrifying nightmares of a city of monsters. He goes to see a psychiatrist, Dr. Decker (David Cronenberg), for help. But what Boone doesn't know is that Decker is really a serial killer. Decker frames Boone to take the fall for his murders, and Boone is killed by the police. But Boone is brought back to life by the monsters of his dreams, the Nightbreed, who in turn join Boone in his quest to stop Decker from killing again.

programme.title: Grizzly
programme.desc: A bloodthirsty grizzly bear stalks two estranged brothers (James Marsden, Thomas Jane) in the Alaskan wilderness.

programme.title: Piranha
programme.desc: When flesh-eating piranhas are accidentally released into a summer resort's rivers, the guests become their next meal.

programme.title: Day of the Dead 2: Contagium
programme.desc: After a military hospital loses control of an experiment, a dangerous virus is unleashed that transforms human beings into zombies.

programme.title: Creepshow III
programme.desc: Macabre tales center on a strange radio, a killer call girl, a haunting, and more in this third installment in an iconic horror anthology series.

programme.title: Phantasm: Remastered
programme.desc: The residents of a small town have begun dying under strange circumstances, leading young Mike (Michael Baldwin) to investigate. After discovering that the Tall Man (Angus Scrimm), the town's mortician, is killing and reanimating the dead as misshapen zombies, Mike seeks help from his older brother, Jody (Bill Thornbury), and local ice cream man Reggie (Reggie Bannister). Working together, they try to lure out and kill the Tall Man, all the while avoiding his minions and a deadly silver sphere.

programme.title: Phantasm III: Lord of the Dead
programme.desc: The evil alien known as the Tall Man (Angus Scrimm) has infiltrated the minds of Mike (A. Michael Baldwin) and Reggie (Reggie Bannister). The two friends embark on a journey to find and kill him, only to discover that he has destroyed town after town, leaving zombies in place of the living. Along the way, Mike and Reggie meet several characters who share their goal, including a murderous boy named Tim (Kevin Connors) and two young women who are excellent fighters.

programme.title: Phantasm IV: Oblivion
programme.desc: Mike escapes the Tall Man, who’d begun to transform him, leaving Reggie to hop dimensions until he finds the truth about the night his brother died.

programme.title: Phantasm: Ravager
programme.desc: The phantasm nightmare comes to an end as reality blurs for a hero in search of his friend and out to vanquish a villain who can be two places at once

programme.desc: Teenager Davey Armstrong is a conspiracy theorist who begins to suspect that a neighboring police officer is a serial killer. With help from three friends, Davey launches a daring investigation that soon turns dangerous.

programme.desc: Trish's slumber party for her basketball teammates includes an unexpected guest.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Arit Anderson discovers a paradise garden in Cambridge which has become a focal point for the local community, and Frances Tophill shares the joy of collecting and saving heirloom vegetable seeds on a visit to Pembrokeshire.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost and Advolly Richmond celebrate the horticultural genius of William Robinson in the gardens of his former home, Gravetye Manor in Sussex. Fresh off the back of her success at Hampton Court Palace Garden Festival, Sue Kent gives her own garden some TLC and creates a special container display using small pots. There's also a passionate grower in London who uses every available space in his garden to grow a vast range of vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Rachel de Thame and Arit Anderson explore the role gardeners can play in having a positive impact on wildlife in their gardens, allotments and communal green spaces. Nick Bailey meets an entomologist on a mission to change perceptions of common garden pests, Kate Bradbury shows how she gardens in harmony with wildlife on her allotment, and there's a look at a city garden where the wildlife is flourishing.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: After a short break, Monty's back at Longmeadow. With a change of seasons, he demonstrates how to prune summer fruiting raspberries, divides perennials and plants daffodils and hyacinths in containers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty turns his attention to his ornamental grass borders, Carol travels to Cheshire to view some heleniums, and Joe is treated to a Jamaican feast when he visits Moor Green Allotments in Birmingham.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As spring gets well underway, Monty Don adds to his collection of fritillaries at Longmeadow with pot-grown plants, as well as sowing some from seed. He also recommends other wildflowers which would thrive in the garden. Carol Klein meets Matt Bishop, who explains why he is attracted to later flowering varieties of daffodils and Rachel de Thame shows a viewer how to get to grips with pruning an overgrown shrubbery.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty presents a masterclass on growing Mediterranean herbs, plants lily bulbs for summer scent, and in the vegetable garden, he begins to sow seeds for salad root crops. Carol Klein is in Devon, where she takes a close look at late summer planting combinations. Meanwhile, in Cumbria, there's a gardener whose passion for exotic plants and dahlias has taken over his family garden and spilled over onto his allotment.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is busy ensuring that his plants are making the most of the warmth and light, and puts to use the homemade fertilizer he made a few weeks ago. He also catches up with his tomato growing trial to see how the different techniques are performing. Carol Klein gets to grips with flowering dogwoods, perhaps the most aristocratic and elegant of all garden trees, and there's a visit to a magical topiary garden in Kent.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty faces some of the most surprising plans yet - a Norwegian garden complete with waterfalls to be fashioned out of a tiny back yard in Dorset, and nothing less than a Japanese tea garden to be created out of a patch of ground in Bromley.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Easter weekend, which means extra time to get out and enjoy the garden. At Longmeadow, Monty plants out sweet peas for summer colour, gives advice on what to use for mulching borders and has plenty of ideas for jobs to get on with this long weekend. Carol Klein is at RHS Rosemoor to revel in the floral spring sensations that epitomise the season. In Scotland, JJ Chalmers explains how important his local park was in helping both his physical and mental rehabilitation.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's all about plants for free at Longmeadow this week as Monty adds self-sown ornamental grass seedlings to the paradise garden. He also divides ferns for planting elsewhere in the garden. Advolly Richmond explores the history of lawns.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team return with a celebration of spring. There's been plenty going on over the winter and lots of new projects in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential rose pruning, Monty plants clematis and rocket, cuts back grasses and makes a start on sowing annuals for colour this summer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As plants begin to show their early growth, Monty gets plenty of plants for free when he demonstrates how to make the most of herbaceous perennials. He also cuts back pelargoniums that have overwintered in the greenhouse and makes a start on sowing vegetables. Nick Bailey shares plans for his new garden in Northamptonshire and shows how to create a container garden ideal for those on the move. Frances Tophill discovers more ways to use cut flowers as she visits a florist in Devon.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets to work in his wildlife garden to ensure that there are plenty of plants in flower for early pollinators. Carol Klein meets Stuart Donachie who has embraced every planting opportunity in his shady garden in Herefordshire, and Frances Tophill invites viewers to grow easy summer vegetables along with her as she trials varieties for taste and productivity at RHS Rosemoor.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein and Joe Swift are at Gardeners' World Live in Birmingham. Joe will be casting an expert eye over the spectacular show gardens, while Carol will be focusing on the delights of the floral marquee.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don tackles the perennial problem of what to grow in the shade beneath a tree, Carol Klein takes a look at the crocosmia and we meet a gardener in Derbyshire who has spent a lifetime growing and showing gladioli.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants garlic, demonstrates how to divide crocosmia and sows ornamental grass seeds. Adam Frost visits Lowther Castle in the Lake District and finds out about its garden restoration project.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost shares the progress that's been made in his garden. Frances Tophill heads to the beach to reveal what gardeners can learn from the coastal plants which have evolved to cope with more extreme conditions.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants mahonia for winter colour and scent, demonstrates how to take salvia cuttings and introduces a special addition to Longmeadow.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty starts work on revamping the writing garden, plants crocus bulbs and harvests pumpkins. Frances Tophill visits a unique plant conservation centre responsible for preserving key historical plants.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants a mix of white flowers in the writing garden, demonstrates how to prune a climbing rose and reviews what's been happening in the vegetable garden. Adam Frost celebrates seasonal colour on a visit to a garden in Essex, and Sue Kent pots up allium bulbs in readiness for spring and replants a tricky border with lavender she's grown from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his loofahs, plants tulip bulbs in pots, gives a masterclass in making leafmould and reflects on the gardening year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Longmeadow is in full bloom, but Monty Don is keen to remind viewers that there is still time to sow some late vegetables, demonstrating how easy it is to grow salad in a pot. It's time to give wisterias their summer prune. An expert, whose 252ft vine was in full flower just weeks ago, shows how she cuts back that summer growth. Meanwhile, Carol Klein has been out and about in Norfolk to revel in the bearded iris.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don visits the iconic garden of impressionist painter Claude Monet at Giverny. As well as revelling in the beauty and colour of Monet's paradise at this time of year, he has a privileged chat to Englishman James Priest, who, just this week, took up his role as head gardener of this world-renowned garden. Back at Longmeadow Monty shares his top tips for growing key culinary herbs.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: By the first week of June, plants are growing with such speed that some have a tendency to flop. Staking is the answer. As well as sharing his tips, Monty Don shows how to make stakes that can be used for many years to come. Now the nights are guaranteed to be frost free, Monty plants out the tender annuals he's raised from seed.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty shows how to harvest and store potatoes. He also adds late summer colour to the cottage garden and prunes shrub roses. Carol Klein travels to Norfolk to meet Adrian Bloom, a member of a horticultural dynasty.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Morocco, Monty discovers the wide variety of paradise gardens. He begins just outside the city of Marrakesh in an enormous royal walled meadow, The Agdal. From there he moves to the heart of the town where he comes upon a tiny garden where huge banana plants jostle with palms to create a secret paradise garden, a shelter from the busy world outside. And in another part of the city a rundown old palace has been turned into a stunning contemporary garden with a twist.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Brighton determined duo Helen and Dax have their hands full with twins, one of whom has special needs. Meanwhile in High Wycombe, newly single Valerie is looking for a fresh lease of life.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost gives tips on lawn repair, grows some unusual vegetables and plants a seasonal container. Advolly Richmond brings us up to date in her history of lawns by exploring the trend for ever more sophisticated machinery.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don tackles autumn lawn maintenance tasks, Carol Klein is looking at burnets, and we meet a man who's dedicated himself to a North American prairie favourite, the echinacea.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team return with a celebration of spring. There's been plenty going on over the winter and lots of new projects in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential rose pruning, Monty plants clematis and rocket, cuts back grasses and makes a start on sowing annuals for colour this summer.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Mopars drag racing in the streets, plus a tour of Tom's barn finds
programme.desc: Tom Cotter discovers some interesting barn finds in Northern Michigans, one of which leads to an impromptu drag race. Next, Tom gives us a tour of the barn find cars he's collected over the years.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Will the faded paint on this dusty Ford Wagon shine like new?
programme.desc: Tom Cotter explores a property Midland, Texas, absolutely filled with old cars. An old Ford wagon catches his eye and Tom attempts to cut through the sun-faded, dust-covered quarter panel to reveal its former glory.

programme.title: The Appraiser | Chris Jacobs' Porsche 911 Targa, a Purple Porsche 930, and a ZL1 Camaro clone
programme.desc: Chris Jacobs stops by to surprise Colin with his ""Daily"" 1985 Porsche 911 Targa and throws Colin for a loop.After that, Colin takes a look at a Porsche 930 Turbo tuned to ""outrun the cops,"" and a ZL1 clone Chevrolet Camaro.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Prodrive P25 Review and a Unique 2-Car Solution
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole reviews Prodrive's INSANE Subaru restomod, the P25.Next, Henry plays a little game of ""2-Car Solution,"" but with an interesting twist: two cars, same engine?

programme.title: One Make: Rising Stars in the Racing World | Presented by Mobil 1
programme.desc: One Make gives an unfiltered look at what it’s like to be an up-and-coming driver in the Toyota Gazoo Racing North America GR Cup Series. This episode features Mia Lovell, Westin Workman, Lucas Weisenberg, and Henry Drury.

programme.title: The Appraiser | Alfa Romeo GTV-6, a "K-Code" GT Mustang, and a Honda S2000
programme.desc: Colin Comer takes a look at a rust-free Alfa Romeo GTV-6, a "K-Code" Ford Mustang GT, and a 2004 Honda S2000 with only 80,0000 miles.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - Pontiac Aztec and an Off-Road Dodge Caravan
programme.desc: Watch as Chip Foose attempts to tackle the design flaws of the often ridiculed Pontiac Aztek.Next, Chip thinks the original Dodge Caravan could use some performance and aesthetic upgrades and produces something... unexpected!

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | 2025 Aston Martin Vantage and Bentley Continental GT
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole reviews latest Aston Martin Vantage, equipped with a powerful twin-turbo V-8. Next, Henry drives the Bentley Continental GT which, while losing it's legendary W-12 engine, still provides a ton of fun via a hybrid-enhanced turbo V-8.

programme.title: RadVentures | Defender and Range Rover off-roading, Ford F-150 Lighting racing
programme.desc: There's lots of fun to be had in these 80's and 90's icons! In this episode of RadVentures, Ryan Symancek goes offroading in a couple old Land Rovers. Next, a 700HP Ford SVT Lighting and $1500 Flareside F-150 go head-to-head on the track.

programme.title: The Appraiser | 2020 Ford GT, 1976 Pontiac Trans-Am, Aston Martin DB4
programme.desc: Colin tries to put a value on a 2020 Ford GT that has one of the most desirable paint combinations and trim packages you could get in 2020. After that, Colin focuses his attention on a 1967 Pontiac Trans-Am and a 1962 Aston Martin DB4.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | 365-ft barn, Jaguar E-Types, and a Vintage SCCA Race Car
programme.desc: Tom meets up with an old friend in South Carolina who shows him a barn full of Jaguars and so much more. Next, Tom travels to New England where he finds a Sunbeam Alpine with SCCA race history and more.

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay | The World's Best-Sounding Drag Race
programme.desc: Lexus LFA vs Porsche Carrera GT vs Audi RS3The World's Heaviest Supercars square off in this episode of Ultimate Drag Race Replay - with the brand-new, 700-hp Ford F-150 Raptor R racing everything it can.

programme.title: MODIFIED - A Safari Audi RS 4 and a Restomod Willys Jeep EV
programme.desc: Matt Farah gets behind the wheel of a JDM B5 Audi RS 4 that's received a Safari conversion courtesy of custom shop AI Design.Next, Matt jumps behind the wheel of a heavily modified WWII-era Willys Jeep.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | McLaren P1 Spider and 750 S Reviews
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews a one-off McLaren P1 Spider and the new McLaren 750 S.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Chevy Corvette ZR-1 and GMC Cyclone
programme.desc: This episode of Revelations with Jason Cammisa starts off with the fascinating story behind the ZR-1 Corvette. After that, Jason dives into GMC Syclone, which was the world's fastest pickup truck... for 30 years!

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - 1970s Muscle
programme.desc: Chip Foose draws what his dream Chevelle would look like. Then he gives us his take on one of the most sought-after cars from the muscle car era, the Plymouth Cuda.

programme.title: The Appraiser | Custom 1970 Ford F100, 1988 Lamborghini LM002, 1971 Ford Bronco
programme.desc: In this episode, Colin Comer appraises a freshly built barn find 1970 Ford F100 pickup truck, an original-owner 1988 Lamborghini LM002 aka the “Rambo Lambo," and a 1971 Ford Bronco that has been used in some interesting off-road situations.

programme.title: ICONS with Jason Cammisa | All things Ford Bronco Raptor
programme.desc: In part 1 of this Ford Bronco Raptor special, host Jason Cammisa dives into the nitty gritty details of the highly capable Ford Bronco Raptor. Next, he drag races it against some very interesting competition.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Oldsmobiles, Mopars, Pontiacs and Fords!
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds Oldsmobile barn find heaven (with some Mopars and Pontiacs sprinkled in for good measure). After that, Tom stumbles upon a 1970 Shelby Mustang GT500 buried in a garage, but in amazing condition.

programme.title: The Appraiser | Shelby GT 350 R "Heritage," a 1987 Buick GNX, and a Shelby-style 1973 Ford Bronco
programme.desc: Colin Comer assesses a just-off-the-lot 2020 Ford Shelby GT 350R Heritage Edition. Next, he looks at a 1987 Buick GNX before moving on to a 1973 Ford Bronco that has been modified as if Carroll Shelby himself had a hand in making it.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | $4M Barn Find - Rare Ferrari and 427 Shelby Cobra hidden for decades
programme.desc: Tom makes an incredible discovery! Behind the doors of a condemned garage lies two amazing cars, a 1966 Ferrari 275 GTB/2 and a 1967 Shelby Cobra 427. Follow along as Tom discovers, helps extract, and then attends the auction for these rare cars.

programme.title: The Next Big Thing with Magnus Walker | 3M-mile Volvo, Baja Bug racing, and 2 cars America never got
programme.desc: Urban Outlaw Magnus Walker drives a 3-million mile Volvo P1800, goes racing in a Baja Bug, and drives two interesting cars that were never offered for sale in America.

programme.title: MODIFIED - The Legendary RUF CTR Yellowbird and a 911-beating Cayman
programme.desc: Bruce Meyer lent Matt Farah this first-built RUF CTR Yellowbird, a car built by one of the most legendary European tuners.Next, Matt jumps in a heavily modified Porsche Cayman and discovers the potential it has for being BETTER than a 911.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - Z-Car, Countach, and XJ Jeep Cherokee
programme.desc: Chip Foose puts pen to paper and reimagines the designs of the Nissan Z, Lamborghini Countrach, and Jeep Cherokee (XJ).

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Greatest Japanese Car Collection in the World, plus a perfect R33 GT-R
programme.desc: Larry Chen has the opportunity to walk through and photography one of the most amazing collections of Japanese cars ever assembled. After that, Larry checks out Mine's and Built by Legends incredible R33 Nissan GT-R.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Turner's Auto Wrecking and hidden Porsche 356
programme.desc: In this episode of Barn Find Hunter, Tom Cotter gets exclusive access to Turner's Auto Wrecking in Fresno, California. After that, he heads high up in the Rocky Mountains of Colorado to discover a Porsche 356 and more.

programme.title: MODIFIED - Skyline GT-R and Flame-spewing Hot Rods
programme.desc: Matt Farah drives two imported modified Nissan Skyline GT-Rs to discover what makes the Skyline the perfect tuner car for whatever your goal.After that, Matt takes you on a wild ride in some insane flame-throwing hot rods.

programme.title: Patrick Dempsey Returns to Racing in "Back on Track"
programme.desc: "Back on Track" takes you behind the scenes of actor Patrick Dempsey's return to racing. Joined by longtime friend and fellow Porsche driver Patrick Long, the two Patricks race in the North America Porsche Endurance Challenge.

programme.title: The Appraiser | 1966 Dodge Charger and 1969 Dodge Coronet Super Bee
programme.desc: Colin has the pleasure of looking over a rust-free 1966 Dodge Charger from the Arizona desert with all the right factory options. Next, Colin appraises a 1969 Dodge Coronet Super Bee that is an all-original California-built car.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Aspen F.A.T. Ice Race and a Review of the Audi R8 GT RWD
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole takes us to the F.A.T. Ice Race in Aspen, CO, which must be the coolest car event on the planet. Next, Henry jumps in what could be the last ever V10-powered Audi R8.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | 1,800 cars in remote area of California
programme.desc: Tom Cotter heads to the "middle of nowhere" in rural California where a unique collection of 1,800 classic cars is slowly returning to the earth. Next, we find Tom in the Carolinas where he discovers a 1954 Chevy Corvette and so much more.

programme.title: RadVentures | V8 Audi Quattro rally car and a Nissan 240SX drift car
programme.desc: What sort of fun can be had with these icons of the 1980's and 1990's? In this episode, Ryan Symancek goes for a wild ride in modified V8 Audio Quattro rally car. Next, Ryan goes drifting in a modified Nissan 240SX.

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay | The World's Quickest Trucks and SUVs
programme.desc: Race 1: World's Quickest SUVs: Rivian R1S vs Aston DBX 707 vs Cayenne Turbo GTRace 2: Rivian R1T vs RAM TRX vs Aston DBC 707 vs Cayenne Turbo GTRace 3: Bronco Raptor vs G63 AMG vs Jeep Wrangler 392 vs Defender V8 vs Gallardo

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Tom's Top 10 Barn Finds from the show
programme.desc: Tom Cotter breaks down his "Top 10" barn finds from the show so far, then goes to visit a friend and hears the story of a lost 1967 Austin Mini Cooper S.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - Ford Bronco and Chevy C8 Corvette
programme.desc: A first-gen Ford Brono gets the full Chip Foose hot rod treatment.Next, can Chip redesign the new mid-engine C8 Corvette to have a stronger connection to Corvettes of the past?

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Millon-dollar barn find collection inherited by 3 sisters
programme.desc: Tom Cotter does what he does best: uses a barn find to learn about ANOTHER barn find! A unique LaSalle eventually leads to a $1,000,000 collection of 40 barn finds that 3 sisters just inherited from their recently passed father.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | 1100 HP Camaro and Corvette, Nissan's Secret to Success
programme.desc: Larry Chen meets up with Jun Hardcore to check out Rocket Bunny Racing's unique, high-horsepower classic Corvette and Camaro builds. Next, Larry discusses Nissans iconic car designs with "The KYZA" and Cody Walker, brother of Paul Walker.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | New V-12 sports cars: the Ferrari 12 Cilindri and Aston Martin Vanquish
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews new Ferrari 12 Cilindri and Aston Martin Vanquish. Both are powered by V-12 engines with the former being naturally aspirated and the latter adding a turbocharger.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Caterham Super Seven 600 and a Famous Old Bentley
programme.desc: In part 1 of this episode of The Driver’s Seat, Henry Catchpole drives the new Caterham Super Seven 600. After that, he has the extraordinary opportunity to drive Eddie Hall's Derby Bentley. Eddie Hall was the only driver to ever complete the 24 Hour

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Liberty Walk Ferrari F40, Tokyo Drift IRL
programme.desc: Larry Chen heads to Japan to check out Libery Walk's "blasphemous" Ferrari F40 custom build. Next, Larry explores the not-so-secret underground car meet right after the Tokyo Auto Salon.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Cleetus McFarland, Spoon Sorts, and Built By Legends
programme.desc: Larry Chen spends the day with YouTube and motorsport sensation Cleetus McFarland. Next, Larry heads to Spoon Sports to check out their heavily modified Honda Civic EG6.

programme.title: The Appraiser | Ferrari Dino and Two Different Shelby Cobras
programme.desc: Colin Comer appraises a Ferrari-that-isn’t-a-Ferrari-but-is-a-Ferrari 246 GT “L-Series” Dino, a legit “Narrow Hip” 427 Shelby Cobra, and a Shelby CSX4000 427 S/C Cobra continuation car.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Lamborghini Miura and the original Acura NSX
programme.desc: This episode of Revelations with Jason Cammisa features the stories behind the Lamborghini Miura and the original Acura NSX

programme.title: The Next Big Thing with Magnus Walker | E39 BMW M5 and Vintage Jeep Grand Wagoneer
programme.desc: Urban Outlaw Magnus Walker drives the E39 BMW M5 and a couple vintage Jeep Grand Wagoneers as he makes the argument as to why these vehicles might be The Next Big Thing in the collector car world.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat w/ Henry Catchpole
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole gets behind the wheel of pair of unique Porsche's. First, it's the legendary Heigo 911 rally car. Next, Henry drives the incredible Ruf SCR that "technically" isn't a Porsche at all.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | 700 Cars Hidden on Colorado Ranch
programme.desc: Tom Cotter explores a ranch in Colorado that holds over 700 classic cars from a specific American brand the owner is quite fond of. Next, stick around for a batch of Barn Finds that didn't make it into previous episodes.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Unimogs, Mercedes 190E 2.3-16 and starting up a barn find
programme.desc: Tom Cotter meets a long-time Mercedes mechanic and tours his collection of Unimogs and turbo diesel old Mercs. Next, Tom in is in the UK where he and a friend attempt to start a Morris Minor that hasn't run in over 20 years.

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay - Hyundai Ioniq 5 N vs Super SUVS | Cadillic LeMans race car
programme.desc: Host Jason Cammisa races the Hyundai Ioniq 5 N against the Lamboghini Urus, Porsche Macan GTS, Jaguar F-Pace SVR and Alfa Romeo Grecale Trofeo. Next, he races Cadillac's Le Mans hypercar vs the Ferrari 296, McLaren 750S, and Porsche 911 Turbo S.

programme.title: The Appraiser | Larry Chen's R32 GT-R and Vin Anatra's BMW M3
programme.desc: Colin Comer welcomes Larry Chen and his R32 Nissan GT-R and offers his professional assessment of what it may be worth. Next, it's Hoonigan's Vin Anatra and his custom BMW M3 that goes under the microscope.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - BMW M3 and Fox-body Ford Mustang
programme.desc: Part 1: Chip Foose brainstorms modifications to an E30 BMW M3.Part 2: Chip takes his pen to the notchback Foxbody Mustang and explores what it may have looked like if Carroll Shelby had a hand in the design

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The Stories of the Mk8 VW GTI and Corrado
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, Jason Cammisa explains why he thinks the Volkswagen Mk7 GTI is a better overall car than the new Mk8.Next, Jason explore the gorgeous styling and impressive performance of the Volkswagen Corrado.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Lifetime collection of cars leaves Tom speechless
programme.desc: Tom visits his old friend Dave Coleman who has collected many more "barn finds" on his property since Tom last saw him. Get a tour of Dave's property that's filled with interesting and rare cars.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Old race car, V8-powered Supra, hot rod Mustang and more!
programme.desc: Tom Cotter meets a gentlemen with 1937 Riley Lynx with a unique racing history. After that, Tom meets a whole family who are into unique "modern classics."

programme.title: The Next Big Thing with Magnus Walker | Lamborghini Espada, Ferrari 308 GT4, and Dodge Viper
programme.desc: Urban Outlaw Magnus Walker drives a Lamborghini Espada and Ferrari 308 GT4 in part one. After that, he jumps in a Dodge Viper. Follow along as he makes the argument as to why these vehicles might be The Next Big Thing in the collector car world

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Dusty Porsche 356 Speedster and an all-original Shelby GT500
programme.desc: In this episode of Barn Find Hunter, Tom Cotter talks with a woman with a dusty 1957 Porsche 356 A Speedster that she and her husband have owned since the 1960s. After that, Tom heads to his hometown and shows a stash of rare barn finds.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The Stories Behind Mercedes' 300SL and W124 500E
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, Jason Cammisa explores the fascinating histories behind two of Mercedes' most iconic cars.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | A Jaguar E-Type story, and What To Do With a Late Friend's Car Collection?
programme.desc: Tom Cotter hears some fun stories from the longtime owner of dilapidated Jaguar E-Type. Next, Tom meets a man who was made executor of his late friend's will. Specifically, he was tasked with managing his unique car collection.

programme.title: The Next Big Thing with Magnus Walker | Jaguar XJS and Vintage Wagons
programme.desc: Urban Outlaw Magnus Walker drives a Jaguar XJS and some vintage long-roof wagons. Follow along as he makes the argument as to why these vehicles might be The Next Big Thing in the collector car world

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Lifetime collection of old Fords & rare motorcycles
programme.desc: Tom Cotter reunites with an old friend from his NASCAR days and gets a tour of his collection of old Fords and rare motorcycles. After that, Tom uncovers an old Corvette and a handful of iconic British sports cars.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Lamborghini Revuelto and a unique Porsche restomod
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews the new Lamborghini Revuelto with its hybrid drivetrain. Next, Henry drives the REEN Concept RSGT restomod which crams a water-cooled 997 GT3 engine in a 964 body.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Fast Wagons: Audi RS4 Avant and BMW M3 Touring
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole puts the latest fast Audi Avant through its paces around town, in the hills and on the amazing Ascari race track in Southern Spain.Next, Henry jumps in another high-performance wagon, the BMW M3 Touring.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | The greatest barn find collection of all time
programme.desc: In this episode of Barn Find Hunter, Tom Cotter meets Billy Eubanks and is unbelievable collection of cars stored in various hand-built garages and structures around his property. It is a truly amazing stash of vehicles!

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The stories behind the Ford GT and original Ford Bronco
programme.desc: Jason Cammisa tells the fascinating backstory of the 2005-2006 Ford GT.Next, Jason tells the story of the Ford Bronco, from the first generation to the current model.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Mitsubishi EVO 5, and Secret Car Collections
programme.desc: Larry Chen travels to Indonesia and discovers a unique twin-charged, 600HP Mitsubishi EVO 5. After that, Larry heads to Singapore to check out its vibrant car culture and explore a secret collection of cars spread across several properties.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Gateway Bronco and Alfaholics Giulia Super R 270 Restomods
programme.desc: Henry drives and reviews Gateway Bronco’s latest and greatest version of its Ford Bronco restomod, the Luxe-GT.Next, Henry jumps in a much different restomod: Alfaholics' Giulia Super R 270.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Spotting cars from an airplane
programme.desc: Tom Cotter rides shotgun in a small airplane in an attempt to spot old cars that would otherwise be hidden from view.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Resurrecting rare Fords, and an incredible Shelby Cobra story
programme.desc: Tom Cotter begins this episode with a 29-year old who is "living the dream" resurrecting rare, old Fords. After that, Tom has the unique opportunity to see Herbie Hancock's Shelby Cobra that the famous musician has owned since new.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture with Larry Chen
programme.desc: Larry Chen attended the GT-R Festival in Australia and came across a very special build that is the brainchild of a pizzeria owner.

programme.desc: Lexus LFA vs Porsche Carrera GT vs Audi RS3The World's Heaviest Supercars square off in this episode of Ultimate Drag Race Replay - with the brand-new, 700-hp Ford F-150 Raptor R racing everything it can.

programme.title: MODIFIED - A Safari Audi RS 4 and a Restomod Willys Jeep EV
programme.desc: Matt Farah gets behind the wheel of a JDM B5 Audi RS 4 that's received a Safari conversion courtesy of custom shop AI Design.Next, Matt jumps behind the wheel of a heavily modified WWII-era Willys Jeep.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | McLaren P1 Spider and 750 S Reviews
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews a one-off McLaren P1 Spider and the new McLaren 750 S.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Chevy Corvette ZR-1 and GMC Cyclone
programme.desc: This episode of Revelations with Jason Cammisa starts off with the fascinating story behind the ZR-1 Corvette. After that, Jason dives into GMC Syclone, which was the world's fastest pickup truck... for 30 years!

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - 1970s Muscle
programme.desc: Chip Foose draws what his dream Chevelle would look like. Then he gives us his take on one of the most sought-after cars from the muscle car era, the Plymouth Cuda.

programme.title: The Appraiser | Custom 1970 Ford F100, 1988 Lamborghini LM002, 1971 Ford Bronco
programme.desc: In this episode, Colin Comer appraises a freshly built barn find 1970 Ford F100 pickup truck, an original-owner 1988 Lamborghini LM002 aka the “Rambo Lambo," and a 1971 Ford Bronco that has been used in some interesting off-road situations.

programme.title: ICONS with Jason Cammisa | All things Ford Bronco Raptor
programme.desc: In part 1 of this Ford Bronco Raptor special, host Jason Cammisa dives into the nitty gritty details of the highly capable Ford Bronco Raptor. Next, he drag races it against some very interesting competition.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Oldsmobiles, Mopars, Pontiacs and Fords!
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds Oldsmobile barn find heaven (with some Mopars and Pontiacs sprinkled in for good measure). After that, Tom stumbles upon a 1970 Shelby Mustang GT500 buried in a garage, but in amazing condition.

programme.title: The Appraiser | Shelby GT 350 R "Heritage," a 1987 Buick GNX, and a Shelby-style 1973 Ford Bronco
programme.desc: Colin Comer assesses a just-off-the-lot 2020 Ford Shelby GT 350R Heritage Edition. Next, he looks at a 1987 Buick GNX before moving on to a 1973 Ford Bronco that has been modified as if Carroll Shelby himself had a hand in making it.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | $4M Barn Find - Rare Ferrari and 427 Shelby Cobra hidden for decades
programme.desc: Tom makes an incredible discovery! Behind the doors of a condemned garage lies two amazing cars, a 1966 Ferrari 275 GTB/2 and a 1967 Shelby Cobra 427. Follow along as Tom discovers, helps extract, and then attends the auction for these rare cars.

programme.title: The Next Big Thing with Magnus Walker | 3M-mile Volvo, Baja Bug racing, and 2 cars America never got
programme.desc: Urban Outlaw Magnus Walker drives a 3-million mile Volvo P1800, goes racing in a Baja Bug, and drives two interesting cars that were never offered for sale in America.

programme.title: MODIFIED - The Legendary RUF CTR Yellowbird and a 911-beating Cayman
programme.desc: Bruce Meyer lent Matt Farah this first-built RUF CTR Yellowbird, a car built by one of the most legendary European tuners.Next, Matt jumps in a heavily modified Porsche Cayman and discovers the potential it has for being BETTER than a 911.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - Z-Car, Countach, and XJ Jeep Cherokee
programme.desc: Chip Foose puts pen to paper and reimagines the designs of the Nissan Z, Lamborghini Countrach, and Jeep Cherokee (XJ).

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Greatest Japanese Car Collection in the World, plus a perfect R33 GT-R
programme.desc: Larry Chen has the opportunity to walk through and photography one of the most amazing collections of Japanese cars ever assembled. After that, Larry checks out Mine's and Built by Legends incredible R33 Nissan GT-R.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Turner's Auto Wrecking and hidden Porsche 356
programme.desc: In this episode of Barn Find Hunter, Tom Cotter gets exclusive access to Turner's Auto Wrecking in Fresno, California. After that, he heads high up in the Rocky Mountains of Colorado to discover a Porsche 356 and more.

programme.title: MODIFIED - Skyline GT-R and Flame-spewing Hot Rods
programme.desc: Matt Farah drives two imported modified Nissan Skyline GT-Rs to discover what makes the Skyline the perfect tuner car for whatever your goal.After that, Matt takes you on a wild ride in some insane flame-throwing hot rods.

programme.title: Patrick Dempsey Returns to Racing in "Back on Track"
programme.desc: "Back on Track" takes you behind the scenes of actor Patrick Dempsey's return to racing. Joined by longtime friend and fellow Porsche driver Patrick Long, the two Patricks race in the North America Porsche Endurance Challenge.

programme.title: The Appraiser | 1966 Dodge Charger and 1969 Dodge Coronet Super Bee
programme.desc: Colin has the pleasure of looking over a rust-free 1966 Dodge Charger from the Arizona desert with all the right factory options. Next, Colin appraises a 1969 Dodge Coronet Super Bee that is an all-original California-built car.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Aspen F.A.T. Ice Race and a Review of the Audi R8 GT RWD
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole takes us to the F.A.T. Ice Race in Aspen, CO, which must be the coolest car event on the planet. Next, Henry jumps in what could be the last ever V10-powered Audi R8.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | 1,800 cars in remote area of California
programme.desc: Tom Cotter heads to the "middle of nowhere" in rural California where a unique collection of 1,800 classic cars is slowly returning to the earth. Next, we find Tom in the Carolinas where he discovers a 1954 Chevy Corvette and so much more.

programme.title: RadVentures | V8 Audi Quattro rally car and a Nissan 240SX drift car
programme.desc: What sort of fun can be had with these icons of the 1980's and 1990's? In this episode, Ryan Symancek goes for a wild ride in modified V8 Audio Quattro rally car. Next, Ryan goes drifting in a modified Nissan 240SX.

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay | The World's Quickest Trucks and SUVs
programme.desc: Race 1: World's Quickest SUVs: Rivian R1S vs Aston DBX 707 vs Cayenne Turbo GTRace 2: Rivian R1T vs RAM TRX vs Aston DBC 707 vs Cayenne Turbo GTRace 3: Bronco Raptor vs G63 AMG vs Jeep Wrangler 392 vs Defender V8 vs Gallardo

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Tom's Top 10 Barn Finds from the show
programme.desc: Tom Cotter breaks down his "Top 10" barn finds from the show so far, then goes to visit a friend and hears the story of a lost 1967 Austin Mini Cooper S.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - Ford Bronco and Chevy C8 Corvette
programme.desc: A first-gen Ford Brono gets the full Chip Foose hot rod treatment.Next, can Chip redesign the new mid-engine C8 Corvette to have a stronger connection to Corvettes of the past?

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Millon-dollar barn find collection inherited by 3 sisters
programme.desc: Tom Cotter does what he does best: uses a barn find to learn about ANOTHER barn find! A unique LaSalle eventually leads to a $1,000,000 collection of 40 barn finds that 3 sisters just inherited from their recently passed father.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | 1100 HP Camaro and Corvette, Nissan's Secret to Success
programme.desc: Larry Chen meets up with Jun Hardcore to check out Rocket Bunny Racing's unique, high-horsepower classic Corvette and Camaro builds. Next, Larry discusses Nissans iconic car designs with "The KYZA" and Cody Walker, brother of Paul Walker.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | New V-12 sports cars: the Ferrari 12 Cilindri and Aston Martin Vanquish
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews new Ferrari 12 Cilindri and Aston Martin Vanquish. Both are powered by V-12 engines with the former being naturally aspirated and the latter adding a turbocharger.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Caterham Super Seven 600 and a Famous Old Bentley
programme.desc: In part 1 of this episode of The Driver’s Seat, Henry Catchpole drives the new Caterham Super Seven 600. After that, he has the extraordinary opportunity to drive Eddie Hall's Derby Bentley. Eddie Hall was the only driver to ever complete the 24 Hour

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Liberty Walk Ferrari F40, Tokyo Drift IRL
programme.desc: Larry Chen heads to Japan to check out Libery Walk's "blasphemous" Ferrari F40 custom build. Next, Larry explores the not-so-secret underground car meet right after the Tokyo Auto Salon.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Cleetus McFarland, Spoon Sorts, and Built By Legends
programme.desc: Larry Chen spends the day with YouTube and motorsport sensation Cleetus McFarland. Next, Larry heads to Spoon Sports to check out their heavily modified Honda Civic EG6.

programme.title: The Appraiser | Ferrari Dino and Two Different Shelby Cobras
programme.desc: Colin Comer appraises a Ferrari-that-isn’t-a-Ferrari-but-is-a-Ferrari 246 GT “L-Series” Dino, a legit “Narrow Hip” 427 Shelby Cobra, and a Shelby CSX4000 427 S/C Cobra continuation car.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Lamborghini Miura and the original Acura NSX
programme.desc: This episode of Revelations with Jason Cammisa features the stories behind the Lamborghini Miura and the original Acura NSX

programme.title: The Next Big Thing with Magnus Walker | E39 BMW M5 and Vintage Jeep Grand Wagoneer
programme.desc: Urban Outlaw Magnus Walker drives the E39 BMW M5 and a couple vintage Jeep Grand Wagoneers as he makes the argument as to why these vehicles might be The Next Big Thing in the collector car world.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat w/ Henry Catchpole
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole gets behind the wheel of pair of unique Porsche's. First, it's the legendary Heigo 911 rally car. Next, Henry drives the incredible Ruf SCR that "technically" isn't a Porsche at all.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | 700 Cars Hidden on Colorado Ranch
programme.desc: Tom Cotter explores a ranch in Colorado that holds over 700 classic cars from a specific American brand the owner is quite fond of. Next, stick around for a batch of Barn Finds that didn't make it into previous episodes.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Unimogs, Mercedes 190E 2.3-16 and starting up a barn find
programme.desc: Tom Cotter meets a long-time Mercedes mechanic and tours his collection of Unimogs and turbo diesel old Mercs. Next, Tom in is in the UK where he and a friend attempt to start a Morris Minor that hasn't run in over 20 years.

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay - Hyundai Ioniq 5 N vs Super SUVS | Cadillic LeMans race car
programme.desc: Host Jason Cammisa races the Hyundai Ioniq 5 N against the Lamboghini Urus, Porsche Macan GTS, Jaguar F-Pace SVR and Alfa Romeo Grecale Trofeo. Next, he races Cadillac's Le Mans hypercar vs the Ferrari 296, McLaren 750S, and Porsche 911 Turbo S.

programme.title: The Appraiser | Larry Chen's R32 GT-R and Vin Anatra's BMW M3
programme.desc: Colin Comer welcomes Larry Chen and his R32 Nissan GT-R and offers his professional assessment of what it may be worth. Next, it's Hoonigan's Vin Anatra and his custom BMW M3 that goes under the microscope.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - BMW M3 and Fox-body Ford Mustang
programme.desc: Part 1: Chip Foose brainstorms modifications to an E30 BMW M3.Part 2: Chip takes his pen to the notchback Foxbody Mustang and explores what it may have looked like if Carroll Shelby had a hand in the design

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The Stories of the Mk8 VW GTI and Corrado
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, Jason Cammisa explains why he thinks the Volkswagen Mk7 GTI is a better overall car than the new Mk8.Next, Jason explore the gorgeous styling and impressive performance of the Volkswagen Corrado.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Lifetime collection of cars leaves Tom speechless
programme.desc: Tom visits his old friend Dave Coleman who has collected many more "barn finds" on his property since Tom last saw him. Get a tour of Dave's property that's filled with interesting and rare cars.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Old race car, V8-powered Supra, hot rod Mustang and more!
programme.desc: Tom Cotter meets a gentlemen with 1937 Riley Lynx with a unique racing history. After that, Tom meets a whole family who are into unique "modern classics."

programme.title: The Next Big Thing with Magnus Walker | Lamborghini Espada, Ferrari 308 GT4, and Dodge Viper
programme.desc: Urban Outlaw Magnus Walker drives a Lamborghini Espada and Ferrari 308 GT4 in part one. After that, he jumps in a Dodge Viper. Follow along as he makes the argument as to why these vehicles might be The Next Big Thing in the collector car world

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Dusty Porsche 356 Speedster and an all-original Shelby GT500
programme.desc: In this episode of Barn Find Hunter, Tom Cotter talks with a woman with a dusty 1957 Porsche 356 A Speedster that she and her husband have owned since the 1960s. After that, Tom heads to his hometown and shows a stash of rare barn finds.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The Stories Behind Mercedes' 300SL and W124 500E
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, Jason Cammisa explores the fascinating histories behind two of Mercedes' most iconic cars.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | A Jaguar E-Type story, and What To Do With a Late Friend's Car Collection?
programme.desc: Tom Cotter hears some fun stories from the longtime owner of dilapidated Jaguar E-Type. Next, Tom meets a man who was made executor of his late friend's will. Specifically, he was tasked with managing his unique car collection.

programme.title: The Next Big Thing with Magnus Walker | Jaguar XJS and Vintage Wagons
programme.desc: Urban Outlaw Magnus Walker drives a Jaguar XJS and some vintage long-roof wagons. Follow along as he makes the argument as to why these vehicles might be The Next Big Thing in the collector car world

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Lifetime collection of old Fords & rare motorcycles
programme.desc: Tom Cotter reunites with an old friend from his NASCAR days and gets a tour of his collection of old Fords and rare motorcycles. After that, Tom uncovers an old Corvette and a handful of iconic British sports cars.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Lamborghini Revuelto and a unique Porsche restomod
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews the new Lamborghini Revuelto with its hybrid drivetrain. Next, Henry drives the REEN Concept RSGT restomod which crams a water-cooled 997 GT3 engine in a 964 body.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Fast Wagons: Audi RS4 Avant and BMW M3 Touring
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole puts the latest fast Audi Avant through its paces around town, in the hills and on the amazing Ascari race track in Southern Spain.Next, Henry jumps in another high-performance wagon, the BMW M3 Touring.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | The greatest barn find collection of all time
programme.desc: In this episode of Barn Find Hunter, Tom Cotter meets Billy Eubanks and is unbelievable collection of cars stored in various hand-built garages and structures around his property. It is a truly amazing stash of vehicles!

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The stories behind the Ford GT and original Ford Bronco
programme.desc: Jason Cammisa tells the fascinating backstory of the 2005-2006 Ford GT.Next, Jason tells the story of the Ford Bronco, from the first generation to the current model.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Mitsubishi EVO 5, and Secret Car Collections
programme.desc: Larry Chen travels to Indonesia and discovers a unique twin-charged, 600HP Mitsubishi EVO 5. After that, Larry heads to Singapore to check out its vibrant car culture and explore a secret collection of cars spread across several properties.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Gateway Bronco and Alfaholics Giulia Super R 270 Restomods
programme.desc: Henry drives and reviews Gateway Bronco’s latest and greatest version of its Ford Bronco restomod, the Luxe-GT.Next, Henry jumps in a much different restomod: Alfaholics' Giulia Super R 270.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Spotting cars from an airplane
programme.desc: Tom Cotter rides shotgun in a small airplane in an attempt to spot old cars that would otherwise be hidden from view.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Resurrecting rare Fords, and an incredible Shelby Cobra story
programme.desc: Tom Cotter begins this episode with a 29-year old who is "living the dream" resurrecting rare, old Fords. After that, Tom has the unique opportunity to see Herbie Hancock's Shelby Cobra that the famous musician has owned since new.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: A once thriving area for wild oysters finds itself in need of rehabilitation. Danny visits a new oyster farm dedicated to building a healthy oyster population.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: "Voices From The Water" tells the stories of five specific champions of rivers (River Heroes), highlighting their direct value to our community ecosystem. We get a firsthand look at the projects these River Heroes undertake to raise awareness about river pollution in their area, and their commitment to solve the waste problem at its source upstream.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: At age seven, Cash “The Conservation Kid” Daniels began leading cleanups along the Tennessee River in his hometown, Chattanooga. Six years later, Cash continues to make a significant impact on the river’s health by strategically collecting fishing waste and inspiring his peers across the world to protect the environment and all the wildlife he holds dear.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: From country music star Brian Kelley’s big 56’ Sunny Briggs Sportfishing Yacht, to getting caught in a storm aboard a small Hurricane deck boat in the Gulf of Mexico, this episode of Stomping Grounds has host Ryan McVinney exploring boat culture in Florida’s Panhandle region, from the Emerald Coast to The Big Bend and the Forgotten Coast. Brian Kelley, aka “Beach Cowboy”, or BK for short, makes up one half of the country music group Florida Georgia Line (FGL) and has just released his own solo album Sunshine State of Mind. Kelley invites viewers aboard his vessel the “Brittney Marie” which was named after his wife, for a look at the couple’s Stomping Grounds. Songs from his album play on the boat’s sound system - including a tune about shopping for a boat on Boat Trader

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson closes out the half way point on the South America Waterfowl Slam. On just the third day of the hunt, he is able to take a Chilean Wigeon and a Rosy Billed Pochard which make species number 9 and 10 of the 20 on his list. Mark is still sharing the blind with Matt Gindorff, a WTA consultant, and they discuss waterfowl hunting in Argentina and how it compares to that of the U.S.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Josh takes his friend Isaiah to the blue water as they look for destin's latest hot bite, the blackfin tuna.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Texas is the home to many exotic species that can be hunted. One species in particular, Axis, have a very large population. Our team got together and had a great time hanging out with a land owner and hunting Axis deer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Throughout the years, our friendships have been forged in deer camps across the country, and this week is a continuation of some of those times. This week, we have Dave Peterson and Mike Winkler from Do All Outdoors and Jurassic Rock in camp with us. When all is said and done, we even got to do a little hunting ourselves and create more memories that will last a lifetime

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This week our team visits The Rocky Creek Ranch with two long time supporters of TTHA, Blake Barnett and John Fink. The goal in this episode is white management, which is something both Blake and John are passionate about. Blake has been hunting many years but what takes place in this hunt is a first.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We love our members. We spent some time in camp with Ron Chandler. Ron Recently renewed his TTHA Membership in 2022 and was awarded a member hunt for 2023. We spend time reflecting on what hunting means to Ron and spending time in camp at G2 with hunters alike.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: New. York. City. That’s where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4—and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredients—from sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintan’s kitchen.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: "Hope you're hungry. In this episode, come along as we eat our weight in sushi and ramen, meet nori farmers and wagyu ranchers, and make some new surfing buddies along the way. P.S. if you're hungry for more Japan content, stay tuned for our next two episodes.In this episode of DIRT, the crew road tripped around Kyushu. The food culture in Kyushu dates back to the emperors of Japan, and the Black Current off the eastern shore has shaped the island's cuisine for centuries. The DIRT team followed that current up the coastline, surfing with new friends and tasting new flavors. And with each stop, we learned even more about how the traditions we keep can honor thousands of years of knowledge—and point the way to the future."

programme.title: FinQuest Outdoors
programme.desc: In the premiere of FinQuest, freshwater pro Ryan Miller dives into the world of saltwater fishing in Florida. Guided by Alex Burgess, Ryan tackles sailfish and tuna while mastering kite fishing. The adventure continues with his family as they enjoy a thrilling hydrofoil ride in Jupiter, Florida, blending fishing excitement with family fun on the water.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: Ryan Miller targets exotic fish in Lake Ida with local guide Kevin Cannon in Episode 2 of FinQuest. Catching peacock bass and clown knife fish, Ryan also enjoys family fun with a skimboarding session in Jupiter, Florida.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiter’s Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryan’s family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiter’s pristine environment.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The positive impact made by the shooting sports and recreational shooting to people across our country can’t be measured in just one story, so we have three. In Florida, Olympian Dania Vizzi trains at her home shooting facility and talk about how she went from ballerina to one of the best shotgun shooters in the world. In Nebraska, firearms instructor Thea Van Syoc has used the disciplines of competitive pistol shooting and training to help shape her life. Finally we’ll take a look into the National African American Gun Association and learn how one day at the range for Phillip Smith created the fastest growing firearm organization in the United States.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nikki Boxler’s life in Update New York on her family farm raising cattle and producing maple syrup is a few thousand miles from the hills of New Mexico. We’ll take a look into Nikki’s life back home and then follow along as she visits the small town of Quemado and its bustling population of 228, while she pursues bugling elk with her favorite Winchester in hand. We’ll also head to Missouri and Texas to chase whitetails with Chris Keefer and Paul Sawyer.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: We set out to tell the tale of Marion - and his legendary Mack’s Prairie Wings, smack dab in the middle of the world famous Stuttgart, Arkansas - the land of ducks and rice. Get an inside look at a man that many consider to be larger than life, from those that knew him best, like his cousin and fellow hell raiser, Bud McCollum. We’ll even hear a story or two from Milton Stovesand, an 81 year old former waterfowl guide and Mack’s employee who actually guided John Olin a time or two, and ran the timber holes with Marion. It’s timber holes and tall tales. It’s cups of coffee and cupped up wings. It’s partners in business, and partners in potholes and it’s pure Arkansas...just like Marion.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Melissa Bachman has made her name over the last two decades as one of the most dedicated hunters and producers in the outdoor industry. In this episode we’ll tag along with Melissa while she chases big game around the world with her Winchester in hand. First, we’ll head to Prince of Whales Island as Melissa tries to catch up to a giant black bear, then travel across the pond to chase mountain ibex, New Zealand for tar, and back to the states for whitetail.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team take a look into enhanced storage and utility options from Boat Outfitters like cooler slides, tackle storage and CoolerWebs . They also tackle applying Tuff-coat paint to the Aquasport project and showcase how easy it is to apply.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team follows the project of a detailed retrofitting of a Bertram upgrading from one motor to twin engines with the help of an Armstrong Bracket. The team then heads to Boatwrench Inc. to rebuild the carburetor for the Glastron project.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: On this weeks episode of Hunting Land Man, Slade and his daughter Asa take on the turkey woods together for the first time. As this is Asa's first time turkey hunting some quick pre hunt preparations are in order. Slade also was able to sit down with a good friend and registered forester to talk fire and the benefits of fire in land management. The next day, Asa and Slade were able to connect with a thundering tom as Asa punched her first ever turkey tag!

programme.title: hunting_land_man
programme.desc: It’s Caleb’s turn to hunt and Slade gets behind the camera. They encounter their target buck, but end up getting a shot at a different buck, and it’s a big boy.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Opening day in Mississippi has arrived and Slade is taking full advantage of it! With the weather not cooperating Slade and Zeb stumble into a turkey hunt they won't soon forget. Two days later, the hot streak continues with Slade connecting on another turkey on an 83 acre property he has for sale! Also, Slade gives some tips and his ideas on small acreage hunting, and how it can be just as lucrative as big tracks of land!
